stanza.line: I went on to the hazel wood,
stanza.linein: Because a fire was in my head,
stanza.line: And cut and peeled a hazel wand,
stanza.linein: And hooked a berry on a thread;
stanza.line: And when white moths were on the wing,
stanza.linein: And moth-like stars were flickering out,
stanza.line: I dropped the berry in the stream
stanza.linein: And caught a little silver trout.

stanza.line: When I had laid it on the floor
stanza.linein: I went to blow the fire flame,
stanza.line: But something rustled on the floor,
stanza.linein: And someone had called me by name:
stanza.line: It had become a glimmering girl
stanza.linein: With apple blossoms in her hair
stanza.line: Who called me by my name and ran
stanza.linein: And faded through the brightening air.

stanza.line: Though I am old with wandering
stanza.linein: Through hollow lands and hilly lands,
stanza.line: I will find out where she has gone,
stanza.linein: And kiss her lips and take her hands,
stanza.line: And walk along the long dappled grass,
stanza.linein: And pluck till time and times are done,
stanza.line: The silver apples of the moon,
stanza.linein: The golden apples of the sun.
